todo_items.title: Fix inconsistent progress state across the app
todo_items.affected_surface: Progress cards on landing page, lesson headers showing XP and lesson completion
todo_items.problem_description: Landing page shows '0/8 lessons complete (0%)' but simultaneously displays '512 XP' and '25% quiz' completion. This is mathematically impossible and confusing. When entering Lesson 1, header shows 'Total XP: 512 · 0/8 lessons' which contradicts the lesson XP counter showing '0/110'. This suggests either test data wasn't cleared, localStorage is corrupted, or state management is broken.
todo_items.why_it_matters: Users cannot trust the progress system if numbers contradict each other. This undermines the entire gamification strategy and makes it impossible to understand actual progress. For an AI literacy course teaching users to spot inconsistencies, having inconsistent data in the app itself is particularly damaging to credibility.
todo_items.suggested_fix: Audit the state management system. Check if progress data is being loaded from localStorage without validation. Add a state consistency check on app load that validates: (1) if lessons_completed === 0, then total_xp should be 0 and quiz_percent should be 0; (2) total_xp should equal sum of all lesson XP earned; (3) quiz_percent should only show if quiz has been started. Implement a 'Reset Progress' function that properly clears ALL state, not just some fields.
todo_items.code_level_hint: Look for localStorage.getItem('progress') or similar. Add validation: if (progress.lessons_completed === 0 && progress.total_xp > 0) { resetProgress(); }. Ensure the 'Reset Progress' button calls a comprehensive clearState() function that removes all localStorage keys related to progress.
acceptance_criteria: Landing page shows consistent numbers: if 0 lessons complete, then 0 XP and 0% quiz
Total XP in header matches sum of lesson XP
